newsitem.title: LATVIA: SAULES BANK WIDENS BLUE CHIP INDEX LINE-UP.
newsitem.headline: SAULES BANK WIDENS BLUE CHIP INDEX LINE-UP.

text.p: Saules Bank on Friday said it had added Riga Shipyard and Valmiera Glassfibre factory to its bourse index, which now covers 93 percent of the exchange's capitalisation.
Saules Bank, Latvia's 9th biggest bank in terms of assets, also said in a statement that it renamed its index into Saules from Saule10.
Saule10 on Friday came to 202.12, an increase by 2.13 percent.
"Given our calculation method, the Saule index on Monday will be fully comparable with Saule10 today," Karlis Krastinsh, the bank's securities department head, told Reuters.
Riga Shipyard, an official list stock, accounted for 22 percent of the stock exhchange's turnover over the last two weeks, the bank said.
Secondary list stock Valmiera Glassfibre accounted for 13 percent of the turnover, the bank said.
